title: EHOP: A Dataset of Everyday NP-Hard Optimization Problems
author: Alex Duchnowski (Saarland University), Ellie Pavlick (Brown University), Alexander Koller (Saarland University), ...
relevance_why: The paper discusses the implications of optimization problems and the ability of Large Language Models (LLMs) to handle them, which can inform methods in audio processing tasks that require optimization.
background: The paper introduces a dataset of optimization problems formatted in natural language, assessing how well LLMs can address these problems compared to traditional formulations.
contribution: This paper introduces the EHOP dataset to investigate the reasoning abilities of LLMs in solving everyday NP-hard optimization problems, highlighting systematic shortcomings.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous studies often focused on textbook problems, limiting their general applicability.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work expands the evaluation to include real-world scenarios and 'inverted' problem formulations, revealing LLMs' reliance on reciting known solutions rather than reasoning.

key_innovation: The dataset captures various problem representations, showing how presentation affects LLM problem-solving abilities.
real_world_impact: Insights from this research could enhance the design of future LLMs for practical applications in optimization, potentially benefiting fields like resource allocation and decision-making.
limitations: The dataset lacks instances of larger problem sizes and does not cover intricate real-world scenarios.

new_terms.NP-hard: **NP-hard** refers to a class of problems for which no known polynomial-time algorithms can find optimal solutions, making them computationally challenging.
new_terms.costumes: **Costumes** in this context refers to the reframing of standard optimization problems into everyday scenarios to assess LLM performance.

open_sourcing: The EHOP dataset will be made publicly available upon acceptance.
